WorkItem.Description:
Could we have a using clause, known from C#, in TypeScript. The only alternative I see right now (as discussed on stackoverflow) is the use of an alias, which is less ideal than simply using the 'using' clause.

The pros of an alias are obvious. Make longer namespaces short. 
The cons are that you're actullay introducing yet another indirection, plus that it still requires a prefix.

The using statement makes the consumption of a nicely modelled codebase much easier.

In case of namecollisions resulting from using the using clause, one can choose to specify the full namespace, or if desired use an alias.

Comments.Message: Thanks for your suggestion assigned to Jon who handles our suggestions.
I hope this gets added in the not-too-distant-future. It would make a lot of code much less verbose.
We'll likely not support 'using' for the same reason we discourage the use of 'with', in that it begins to make names confusing (where do they come from?) and adds lots of extra work on the compiler.
